summary: This is an email from August 28, 2019, forwarding a request for the release of the final Medical Examiner's report on Jeffrey Epstein's death on August 10, 2019, to the FBI and specifically to NYPD Detective Paul Courtney. It shows coordination between the FBI and NYPD regarding the investigation into Epstein's death.

persons.name: Gildea, Michael O.
persons.context: Appears as a recipient of the forwarded email regarding the request for the Medical Examiner's report on Epstein's death.

persons.name: Courtney, Paul G.
persons.role: NYPD Detective / FBI Task Force Member
persons.context: Identified as an NYPD detective assigned to the FBI's Violent Crimes Task Force, and the specific recipient to whom the Medical Examiner's report on Epstein's death should be released.

persons.name: John Rogan
persons.context: Copied on the email and described as the person who oversees the FBI's Task Force.

persons.name: Sgt Chris Daly
persons.context: Copied on the forwarded email regarding the Medical Examiner's report request.

persons.name: Nicholas Schultz
persons.role: Deputy Director of Forensic Investigations/Forensic Operations
persons.context: The primary addressee of the original email, being asked to release the Medical Examiner's final report on Jeffrey Epstein's death.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the Medical Examiner's report, having died on August 10, 2019.

connections.description: John Rogan is described as overseeing the Task Force to which Detective Courtney is assigned.
Both are law enforcement officials (NYPD and FBI) copied on the same official communication regarding the Epstein death investigation.

events.title: Death of Jeffrey Epstein
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein died on this date, prompting a Medical Examiner's investigation and report.

events.title: Request for Medical Examiner's Report
events.description: An email is sent requesting the release of the final Medical Examiner's report on Epstein's death to the FBI and Detective Paul Courtney.

keyFacts: The document is a request for the final Medical Examiner's report on Jeffrey Epstein's death on August 10, 2019, to be released to law enforcement.
It shows inter-agency coordination, with an NYPD detective (Paul Courtney) assigned to the FBI's Violent Crimes Task Force being the designated recipient.
The request was made on August 28, 2019, indicating ongoing investigative activity related to Epstein's death nearly three weeks after it occurred.
